p: Cook et al. (2019) recently showed distinct but synergistic roles for IFN-α and β in controlling CHIKV replication and disease. While IFN-α acts in non-hematopoietic cell types, reducing replication and early dissemination of CHIKV, IFN-β has a substantial impact on pathogenesis, since it can limit neutrophil-mediated inflammation at the site of infection ( Cook et al., 2019).
